column1: '''Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!''' was a [[Khuzdul]] battlecry.
==History==
Though the battle-cry was much older
column2: the first recorded use was in the [[Battle of the Hornburg]]:

column1: <blockquote>''But a [[Gimli|small dark figure]] that none had observed sprang out of the shadows and gave a hoarse shout: ''Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!'' An axe swung and swept back. Two Orcs fell headless. The rest fled.''<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
Later
column2: Gimli gave some variations on the battle-cry: ''Khazâd! Khazâd!'' and ''Khazâd ai-mênu!''.

column1: ==Etymology==
The cry is translated "Axes of the Dwarves! The Dwarves are upon you!".<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column4: I: The Languages and Peoples of the Third Age; Of Dwarves</ref>
